{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3547188,"name":"Vihaan C","username":"VihaanC","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/vihaanc/{size}/237555_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-04T15:22:31.088Z","cooked":"

Hey everyone,

Our team has been experiencing some issues with pose estimation using a Limelight, and we’re hoping to get some advice. We’ve attached a video showing the problem, along with a link to our code.

Issues We’re Seeing:

  1. Incorrect Pose Until Driving

  • Sometimes, the pose estimate is completely wrong.

  • After driving for a bit, it corrects itself and moves to the right pose (shown in the video).

  1. Inaccuracy at a Distance

  • When the robot is farther away from an AprilTag, the pose estimate seems to be inaccurate.

  • Would filtering out detections beyond a certain distance help?

  • Would decreasing the max ambiguity threshold improve accuracy?

  1. Pose Updates Causing Path Stuttering in Autonomous

  • During auto, when an AprilTag is detected, the path starts to stutter.

  • Our current fix is to move the robot in front of the tag, allow detection for 3-4 seconds, then disable it.

  • We assume this happens because the vision updates the pose, conflicting with the commanded trajectory.

  • Is there a better way to handle this?

  1. Driver Input Being Overridden

  • Occasionally, when the driver moves the joystick and the Limelight detects an AprilTag for the first time, the robot ignores the joystick input.

  • Instead, it continues moving at the velocity it had when the tag was first seen, then stops after a few seconds.

  • Has anyone seen this behavior before?

Any suggestions on how to improve our pose estimation would be greatly appreciated!

Video: LimelightPoseIssue - Google Drive
Code: GitHub - PerkValleyRobotics/2025RobotCode

Thanks!

VihaanC:

Incorrect Pose Until Driving

I am by no means an expert on this topic but I think this behavior is expected because the pose estimation works in tandem with internal odometry and if internal odometry is way off it will take some driving around to correct it with the vision. Not an expert on the topic just my understanding.

I was thinking in a similar pattern. Since in the code filters incorrect poses, it would be far enough away that it might not accept it.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-03-04T16:27:35.283Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":81,"readers_count":80,"score":16.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":494188,"topic_slug":"limelight-pose-estimation-issues-incorrect-poses-auto-stuttering-and-driver-control-lockups","display_username":"Vihaan C","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":56380,"username":"ebear11","name":"Elijah Beard","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/439d5e/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69367,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 7414 | scouting lead | programming | milling"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-pose-estimation-issues-incorrect-poses-auto-stuttering-and-driver-control-lockups/494188/3","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3547279,"name":"James Barnes","username":"NotJames","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/notjames/{size}/246860_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-04T16:49:06.825Z","cooked":"

Check vision.java. You’ll reject pose updates from single tags if ambiguity is too high.

Increasing resolution of the limelight will improve vision pose accuracy at distance but also decrease FPS. Additionally there’s some good recommendations for rejecting/reducing confidence from pose updates if targets are too far away as well as if the robot is rotating or traversing at high speeds.

limelight

  LimelightHelpers.SetRobotOrientation("limelight", m_poseEstimator.getEstimatedPosition().getRotation().getDegrees(), 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
  LimelightHelpers.PoseEstimate mt2 = LimelightHelpers.getBotPoseEstimate_wpiBlue_MegaTag2("limelight");
   
  // if our angular velocity is greater than 360 degrees per second, ignore vision updates
  if(Math.abs(m_gyro.getRate()) > 360)
  {
    doRejectUpdate = true;
  }
  if(mt2.tagCount == 0)
  {
    doRejectUpdate = true;
  }
  if(!doRejectUpdate)
  {
    m_poseEstimator.setVisionMeasurementStdDevs(VecBuilder.fill(.7,.7,9999999));
    m_poseEstimator.addVisionMeasurement(
        mt2.pose,
        mt2.timestampSeconds);
  }
